result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Final pre-trial conference on February 14, 2023 at 9:20 am.
Final plea hearing on April 13, 2023 at 2:00 pm.
Jury trial on April 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:35 AM Cases called: 22CF320, 22TR3840R, & 22TR3673. Defendant Jared S McGriff in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Jared S McGriff.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 30 days to file motions. 10:39 AM
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Lippert
Additional Discovery letter filed by Atty Lippert to Atty Sarbacker
filed by Atty Sarbacker requesting reset for the 10/5/22 prelim
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:12 AM Cases called: 22CF320, 22TR3840R, and 22TR3673. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jared S McGriff in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Jared S McGriff. Attorney Sarbacker requested a preliminary hearing. There is no discovery at this time. Attorney Sarbacker is to see Br. 3 JA to get notice in hand. 9:13 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
